nodes.bodyText: I don't like this. Obfuscation for the sake of passing some test(s) makes no sense to me.
Which test was this related to?

The test already seems to have an exception for publicPath. I think it would be better to keep the code clean and add a similar exception in the test. But also the publicPath is not used anymore (it was previously used in the webpack output options) so that could be replaced with an exception for this rootUrl.
So something like (note that all whitespaces have been removed at this point):
.filter(line -> !line.startsWith("constrootUrl="))
Instead of the current:
.filter(line -> !line.startsWith("publicPath:"))
Remove this use of "SERVLET_PARAMETER_PRODUCTION_MODE"; it is deprecated.
Remove this use of "SERVLET_PARAMETER_USE_V14_BOOTSTRAP"; it is deprecated.
Immediately return this expression instead of assigning it to the temporary variable "relativePath".
Remove this use of "REQUIRE_HOME_NODE_EXECUTABLE"; it is deprecated.

it doesn't have the filter .filter(key -> !FrontendUtils.INDEX_HTML.equals(key))
Is this a wrong comment or the filter was accidentally missing?
Yeah looking at this commit b072579 it looks like a copy paste mistake to me? The comment is added to two places but filter only in one of them.
Is there a ticket for this?

Created: #9082
Should I mention the link in TODO also?
Complete the task associated to this TODO comment.
